result.execSummary:
The defendant Derrick Pagel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not possess any prescriptions without a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by physician.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC.
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall notify Agent, within 48 hours, of any medication change.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.

timeConds.notes:
Stay 6 months, to be utilized by Agent upon application to the Court.

Consecutive to: to 15CF135 but concurrent with 15CF169.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Pagel

4:17 pm 
DA Snider present.
Def. present.
Atty. Tom Johnson present.
Statements by DA Snider re:  PSI corrections - decimals point.
Court will note decimal points to be written in front of grams.
Recommendations by DA Snider & Atty. Johnson.
Statements by def.
15 CF 135 - Ct. #3 - Fine $100.00 + costs - 6 months co jail w/Huber priv.
15 CF 135 - Ct. #4 - Fine $100.00 + costs - 30 days co jail w/Huber priv. - consecutive to Ct. #3
15 CF 169 - probation - SW - 3 years - concurrent with 15 CF 197
15 CF 197 - probation - SW - 3 years - concurrent with 15 CF 169
Conditions:
1.  pay costs of the action.
2.  pay supervision fees.
3.  15 CF 169 - buy money $250.00 - WI Dept of Crim. Investigation #15-2587/3
4.  15 CF 197 - buy money $180.00 - Waupaca Police Dept #15-02846
5.  def. to participate in any assessments deemed appropriate by his Agent and follow treatment recommendations arising therefrom.
6.  def. to participate in any other counseling as directed by his Agent.
7.  def. to not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter. 961.
8.  def. to not possess any prescriptions w/o a valid prescription and take in manner and method as prescribed by his physician - w/in 48 hours of any medication change, def. to notify Agent.
9.  def. to obtain prescriptions from 1 pharmacy.
10.  def. to perform 50 CSW hours (total).
11.  def. to serve 12 months co jail w/WR privileges - consecutive to jail sentence in 15 CF 135 - the Court will stay 6 months to be utilized by his Agent upon application to the court.
No credit on 15 CF 169/15 CF 197.
7 days credit on 15 CF 135.
Def. to report today to Waupaca Co SO to set up reporting date - to commence w/in 60 days of today's date.
Appeal rights explained to def.
Firearm restrictions explained to def.
Voter ineligibility restrictions explained to def.
